I promise to do everything I can to get it up to speed ASAP (after HyperEdit) - I assure you it is not abandoned.  ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

All,

I found the problem in the Graphotron and fixed it, sent the changes to [@Ezriilc](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/34556-ezriilc/)

So there should be a new version released in the next day or so

Linuxgurugamer

I've just uploaded the new release as version 0.4 for KSP 1.1.2. http://www.Kerbaltek.com/graphotron All thanks go to [@linuxgurugamer](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/129964-linuxgurugamer/) for this one, as well as HyperEdit. ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif ":cool:")

Any possibility of getting this to track the outputs of the surface ore scanner? It would be epic to be able to be able to record lat/long and ore percent, export to CSV, then graph in excel or a GIS program to create a detailed ore map.

Yes!  That would be great.  I see no reason why not, when and if our programmers can get to it.  Thanks for the great idea!

Glad to see this make to a 1.1.2 release... I'm working on a mod, that will have a specific part for use with Graphotron... ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

With the recent pre-release, I'm able to publish Graphotron 0.4.1 for KSP 1.2.  The only thing that's changed is the location of exported files - they now go to Screenshots/Graphotron.

[http://www.Kerbaltek.com/graphotron](http://www.Kerbaltek.com/graphotron)

As always, please let me know if you have any issues.

so what's new with the graphotron ?

>

> 56 minutes ago, Apurva Kawthalkar said:
> 
> 
> so what's new with the graphotron ?
> 

Not much really.  I moved the output files to a special directory inside "screenshots", and made it work with KSP 1.2.  You'll find all related info on our mods at our site.

[http://www.kerbaltek.com/graphotron](http://www.kerbaltek.com/graphotron)
Can graphotron track other data like vertical velocity or G-force?

> 
> 
> 15 hours ago, delta wee said:
> 
> 
> Can graphotron track other data like vertical velocity or G-force?
> 

Yes, generally.  You can track velocity relative to the surface and orbit, and if you have a Gravioli detecter's display turned on, it will track that too.

EDIT:  It doesn't appear to track G-forces.  I will see about adding that someday.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-11-24T19:05:40Z" title="11/24/2016 07:05  PM" data-short="7 yr">November 24, 2016</time> by Ezriilc**

>

> 15 hours ago, delta wee said:
> 
> 
> Can graphotron track other data like vertical velocity or G-force?
> 

I've just uploaded a BETA version of Graphotron that includes these new features.  Please give it a try and tell me what you think.  I don't know the difference between G-Force and G-Force Immediate, so I just put both in.

[http://www.Kerbaltek.com/graphotron](http://www.kerbaltek.com/graphotron)

Thanks, the changes for the new data sources work fine.

Some other things I think would make using the Graphotron better:

- A scrollable plot window, so data isn't lost once it reaches the left side.
- Not requiring the Graphotron part to be attached to the vehicle for graphs to work. Right now it is awkward to use if you have fairings on the payload because if you want to use the graphs on the last stage you need to put the part inside the fairing, which makes it so you can't activate it at the start of the launch.
- An "Advanced Data Sources" section that contains all meaningful data sources.
- The ability to minimize all Graphotron windows, maybe by having a button on the top-right for Graphotron similar to what Kerbal Engineer has.
- Have the time data be based off the actual time in the game. Right now if you do a time warp while plotting data it will get compressed and make the graphs look bad.
